brief: This command returns detailed information about an existing client class.
name: class-get
resp-comment: The returned information depends on the DHCP server type, i.e. some parameters are specific to the DHCPv4 server. Also, some parameters may not be returned if they are not set for the client class. If a class with the specified name does not exist, a result of 3 (empty) is returned. If the client class is found, the result of 0 is returned. If there is an error while processing the command, the result of 1 is returned.
resp-syntax: "test": <test expression to be evaluated on incoming packets>,
